author: arxis75
content: Hi. Recently noticed that old EIP-155 transactions (ex: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xa8f503d99f9eef98e6619ba290b7bf0b55ec0bdce259cfc55734e4d1efc2d198) do not encode 9 fields, but only 6. It contradicts the same EIP that states that if v in {35,37}, it SHOULD encode 9 fields. Has this requirement been modified?

author: samwilsn
content:
Legacy transaction do encode nine values: https://ethereum.github.io/execution-specs/autoapi/ethereum/paris/eth_types/index.html#legacytransaction

Etherscan doesn't seem to show the signature fields (`v`, `r`, and `s`)

author: arxis75
content: I was decoding the raw transaction displayed by etherscan. I did found v, r and s, but somehow the 3 following mandatory elements: ``chainid, 0, 0`` are not part of the raw transaction.

author: samwilsn
content: Ah, are you thinking about the signing hash? https://ethereum.github.io/execution-specs/autoapi/ethereum/paris/spec/index.html#signing-hash-155

author: arxis75
content:
See https://etherscan.io/getRawTx?tx=0xa8f503d99f9eef98e6619ba290b7bf0b55ec0bdce259cfc55734e4d1efc2d198

author: samwilsn
content: When signing, you use `chainId`, `0`, and `0` for `v`, `r`, and `s` respectively

author: arxis75
content: Ah ok, I get it now! It is embedded in the signature, but not in the signed transaction.
